intro: Tabernaemontana stenoloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star of India, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white, pink, and yellow. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot.
